TopicTitle: BSC: Albatross 3 - And the winner is...

Articles.Content:
craft file updated again. Added fuel lines, science equipment, batteries etc.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55829-BSC-Albatross-3-Start-building%21?p=740113&viewfull=1#post740113

My first submission to a BSC challenge; be gentle!

Totally Legit Aerospace Ltd (Makers of fine aircraft, spacecraft & small household goods) is proud to present the Kerbaltross I.......

Your craft is amazing, could I possibly use it as a high-altitude reconnaisance aircraft?

Updated craft with more science and some fuel lines for more stable long range flight.

Oh and changed my signature to reflect what I have done since the release of 0.22 not that anyone actually cares.

Edited November 2, 2013 by mcirish3
Changing the name of my kraft to the Kalkakross Keighteen

Your craft is amazing, could I possibly use it as a high-altitude reconnaisance aircraft?

Be my guest!
Allright - all submission are closed...now give me some time...

Haha I was just joking about the name change. I am not a fan of putting the letter K everywhere.

Edited November 2, 2013 by GusTurbo

Hey everybody here are my test notes from the planes! Please read the preface to help understand what I did and use at your own risk.

http://www./view/68fo0g7sc2r6keo/BSC_Judging_Notes.docx

http://www./view/8sd1q0gd9s8c56a/BSC_Judging_Notes.pdf

Slight update to testing doc as I was in a hurry when writing preface. I added forum names after the names of their planes in the doc. And I added a pdf version in case people can't open a word doc!

Enjoy!!!

Edited November 3, 2013 by gm537
Update doc and add pdf version

Primary elections have started! Vote

here!

Please drop a few line who you've voted for!

Get all .craft files in a single zip file HERE

Primary elections will run for 48 hours - the six (or so) best entries will enter the final 24h-election!

Please check the challenge guidelines - even if you just want to vote!

And remember to come back in two days!
hm, sorry Gus - now you have to run with Kalkakross Keighteen in the poll ^^

hm, sorry Gus - now you have to run with Kalkakross Keighteen in the poll ^^

GusTurbo wins KSP. That is the best plane by looks.

I think that the planes by Mhoram, Rhomphaia and whistlehead are the best. Also, the one by Zekes seems to be WAAAY too fast, as the Albatross is meant to be a slow plane. Sadly, I didn't submit anything, so I'm not allowed to vote.

GusTurbo wins KSP. That is the best plane by looks.

So? You're not supposed to vote on just looks. It's all about the best plane. Not the best-looking one. I think you should vote for something other than the one you think looks best.

I think that the planes by Mhoram, Rhomphaia and whistlehead are the best. Also, the one by Zekes seems to be WAAAY too fast, as the Albatross is meant to be a slow plane. Sadly, I didn't submit anything, so I'm not allowed to vote.

I may be wrong about this, but so far as I'm aware you can vote without entering.
Anybody may vote...

hm, sorry Gus - now you have to run with Kalkakross Keighteen in the poll ^^

Nooooo now I'm going to lose because of the stupid name.

Haha oh well. This was a fun design exercise for me, and I'm mostly just pleased with how it turned out, even if I don't win.

Nooooo now I'm going to lose because of the stupid name.

Haha oh well. This was a fun design exercise for me, and I'm mostly just pleased with how it turned out, even if I don't win.

Says the guy who's winning.

I was winning right out of the gate in the Heavy Lander challenge too, and I didn't even make it past the primary. It takes a long time to test all the planes (especially since there's 30 of them this time), so expect to see a lot of movement later on.

I think that the planes by Mhoram, Rhomphaia and whistlehead are the best. Also, the one by Zekes seems to be WAAAY too fast, as the Albatross is meant to be a slow plane. Sadly, I didn't submit anything, so I'm not allowed to vote.

Thanks, also you don't have to enter to vote.

Testing all these entries is going to be a challenge in itself, especially since I am working 12 hour shifts just now.

Also a belated thanks to MiniMatt and McIrish3 foir your comments on my entry in the super heavy lander challenge.

I was winning right out of the gate in the Heavy Lander challenge too, and I didn't even make it past the primary. It takes a long time to test all the planes (especially since there's 30 of them this time), so expect to see a lot of movement later on.

Good point.
I'm still annoyed that I missed the Super-Heavy Lander Challenge.

I'm still annoyed that I missed the Super-Heavy Lander Challenge.

I am to. I could have won with the Duna Tripper 6
Someone voted for my Goose?!

I'm putting my testing notes on mediafire if anyone is curious to see how their plane fared.
